main event: A witness in Durand, Michigan observed a round amber light in the sky on July 27, 1967.
interesting points: The object was a little less bright than a full moon and made no noise.
The sighting was not reported until February 1968, at which point it was too late to investigate.
The object was visible for 2-3 minutes before going behind some trees.
The witness estimated the object's size to be about half the width of a match stick held at arm's length.
The object moved slowly and was described as a 'bit amber in color'.
